results.title: Territorial rights
results.creator_credit: Ian Woolf, Tony Matthews and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Interaction”.
Part 7 of a series of films for managers. Examines the reasons why so many misunderstandings occur between specialists and the “line” managers they advise. A film of an argument between a production manager and a services engineer is used as the basis for a discussion between personnel, finance and works managers, and consultants on the sources of interdepartmental problems. Introduced by Brian Redhead.

results.title: Termite colony: a complex social organization
results.brief_description: A discussion of the polymorphic social organisation within an African termite colony, describing the unique roles of the queen, soldiers, and workers in the colony. Shows the care for the queen during the egg laying stage and the care for the young after the eggs hatch; the cultivation of a food supply for the colony; the defence of the colony by the soldiers; and the repair of the nest by the workers.

results.title: Teresa's story
results.creator_credit: John Anderson, Brent Productions and Wellington Community Law Centre
results.brief_description: This program was designed for use by schools and community groups, targets 12 to 17 year olds and people supporting them, and aims to inform about how the Child Protection system deals with reported abuse, the right of young people to personal safety and their legal rights under the Care and Protection Section of the Children, Young Persons and their Families Act, New Zealand.

results.title: Tennis instruction series
results.creator_credit: Dr Frank Ryan and Ryan Films
results.brief_description: The popularity of tennis is shared by all ages and most countries of the world. Shows the basic rules of tennis, demonstrates how the ball should be hit to produce various shots and strokes. Stresses the importance of good service, strong body and leg muscles, top physical condition, good foot work and co-ordination between mind, eye and body.

results.title: Tennis elbow
results.creator_credit: John Thomson and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: A tennis match provides the basis for a series of hilarious visual gags. A combination of absurd humour and satire is perpetrated by those graduates of the fringe comedy circuit, Kelso and Curtis and Los Trios Ringbarkus. Erwin Rado Award for Best Australian Short Fiction, Melbourne Film Festival 1983.

results.title: Tennessee Williams: theater in process
results.creator_credit: Richard Slote, Suzanne Tedesko, Encyclopaedia Britannica Educational Corporation and Signet Productions
results.brief_description: A behind-the-scenes look at the production of the play “The red devil battery sign” by Tennessee Williams. Tennessee Williams talks about his career and about writing a play and how he works with a director rather than with the actors. The film shows a press conference, rehearsals of lines and then full rehearsals during which the director conveys his interpretation of some of the important symbols and speeches in the play
